This method determines which event was generated if the user clicked any button, selected an option from the main menu or the ComboBox

B

This method returns the investment's bookValue for a given index position from the ArrayList

This method returns the updated bookValue and quantity of the investment whose shares are to be purchased
buy(int, String, String, ArrayList<Investment>) - Static method in class ePortfolio.MutualFund
This method returns the updated bookValue and quantity of the mutualfund whose shares are to be purchased
buy(int, String, String, ArrayList<Investment>) - Static method in class ePortfolio.Stock
This method returns the updated bookValue and quantity of the stock whose shares are to be purchased
buyButton(ArrayList<Investment>, HashMap<String, ArrayList<Integer>>, JComboBox<String>, JTextField, JTextField, JTextField, JTextField, JTextArea) - Static method in class ePortfolio.Portfolio
This method fetches the investment's name,symbol,quantity and price from their respective text fields, buys that investment, adds it to the ArrayList of investments,add its keywords to the HashMap: nameAndIndex and prints appropriate messages to its respective text area when the "Buy" button from the "Buy" JPanel is pressed
buyHashIndex(Investment, HashMap<String, ArrayList<Integer>>, ArrayList<Investment>) - Static method in class ePortfolio.Portfolio
This method will update the HashMap when a new investment is added to its ArrayList

C

calculateGain(ArrayList<Investment>, JTextArea) - Static method in class ePortfolio.Investment
This method calculates the gain for all the investments

D

duplicateInvestment(String, String, ArrayList<Investment>) - Static method in class ePortfolio.Investment
This method checks if a new investment has the same symbol as an existing investment and vice-versa returns 0 if the new investment's symbol does not already exist returns 1 if the new investment's symbol already exists

validPriceRange(String) - Static method in class ePortfolio.Portfolio
This method determines what kind of price range was provided when the user selected the "Search" option and returns an int value based on that Valid Range examples: 10-10,-10,10-,10-20

This method verifies if the user entered a valid lower and upper range when the user selected the "Search" option and prints an appropriate message to its respective text area if it is invalid
